required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety of Percutaneous Tracheostomy in Clopidogrel and Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors
clinical_study.official_title: Safety of Percutaneous Tracheostomy in Clopidogrel and Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

brief_summary.textblock: Safety of Percutaneous Tracheostomy in Clopidogrel and Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

detailed_description.textblock: We propose a retrospective review of our experience with bleeding complication in the presence of antiplatelet and SSRI therapy and compare the complications with those who were not on antiplatelet agents or SSRI.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Not sure. PI is no longer at OSU.

primary_outcome.measure: a retrospective review of our experience with bleeding complication in the presence of antiplatelet and SSRI therapy and compare the complications with those who were not on antiplatelet agents or SSRI

study_pop.textblock: The study is being done to evaluate the safety of percutaneous tracheostomy in patients taking antiplatelet agents such as aspirin and/ or clopidogrel or selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors. We will identify all patients age 18 or older who have undergone percutaneous tracheostomy by interventional pulmonology at OSUMC and access their PHI to record variables (see data collection form).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- on antiplatelet therapy or selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors(SSRI)
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A
